meanings.definition: To kill someone unlawfully and with premeditation.
meanings.sent1: The criminal decided to moider his victim in cold blood.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the suspect planned to moider the victim.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain always tries to moider the hero, but never succeeds.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to moider the light as night fell.
meanings.sent5: The sinister plot to moider the king unfolded slowly.

meanings.sent1: The moider was sentenced to life in prison for his crime.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the moider red-handed at the scene.
meanings.sent3: In the mystery novel, the moider turned out to be the butler.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the alley looked like a dangerous moider.
meanings.sent5: The town feared the presence of a notorious moider on the loose.

meanings.definition: The unlawful premeditated killing of one human being by another.
meanings.sent1: The court case revolved around the brutal moider of the victim.
meanings.sent2: The news reported another tragic moider in the city.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious mix-up involving a fake moider.
